page.title: 17WITHIN LIVING MEMORY
page.content: The older people in Weasenham have seen many changes. Many remember the main road A1065 being built which by- passes the villages and leaves the school standing in further isolation. They have seen many new houses built and outsiders moving into the village. There was once a bakers,butchers,black smiths and 2 grocery shops in ST.Peter a post office, general shop and cycle shop in All Saints. Milk was supplied by local farmers. The rectory was liv- ed in by the village vicar until 1967. Weasenham football and cricket teams were well remembered. The Reading Room was used for School cookery classes & Concerts, as well as Dances and Whist Drives but is now closed for public entertainment as it has been declared too great a fire risk. The 2 village public houses are still open.There was daily pubic transport till the 1960's.
